courses.name: Computer Science 101

assessments.title: Assignment 1 - Basic Programming
assessments.description: Basic programming concepts and problem solving

assessments.title: Quiz 1 - Variables and Loops
assessments.description: Understanding variables, data types, and loop structures

assessments.title: Assignment 2 - Functions
assessments.description: Function implementation and modular programming

assessments.title: Midterm Exam
assessments.description: Comprehensive exam covering first half of course

assessments.title: Final Project
assessments.description: Complete programming project demonstrating all concepts

otherInfo: All assignments must be submitted through the course portal
Late submissions will receive a 10% penalty per day
Office hours are available both in-person and online

courses.name: Mathematics 201

assessments.title: Homework 1 - Linear Algebra
assessments.description: Vector operations and matrix calculations

assessments.title: Quiz 1 - Matrix Operations
assessments.description: Matrix multiplication and determinants

assessments.title: Homework 2 - Eigenvalues
assessments.description: Eigenvalue and eigenvector calculations

assessments.title: Midterm Exam
assessments.description: Comprehensive exam on linear algebra concepts

assessments.title: Final Exam
assessments.description: Final comprehensive exam covering all course material

otherInfo: Calculators are allowed on all exams
Homework must be handwritten and scanned
Collaboration on homework is encouraged but write-ups must be individual

courses.name: Physics 101

assessments.title: Lab Report 1 - Motion
assessments.description: Analysis of motion experiments and data collection

assessments.title: Quiz 1 - Mechanics
assessments.description: Basic mechanics and Newton's laws

assessments.title: Lab Report 2 - Forces
assessments.description: Force analysis and free body diagrams

assessments.title: Midterm Exam
assessments.description: Exam covering mechanics and motion

assessments.title: Final Exam
assessments.description: Comprehensive final exam

otherInfo: Lab attendance is mandatory
Safety goggles must be worn in all lab sessions
Lab reports must be submitted within one week of the experiment

courses.name: English Literature 201

assessments.title: Essay 1 - Shakespeare Analysis
assessments.description: Critical analysis of selected Shakespeare works

assessments.title: Participation Grade
assessments.description: Class participation and discussion contributions

assessments.title: Essay 2 - Modern Literature
assessments.description: Analysis of 20th century literature

assessments.title: Midterm Paper
assessments.description: Comprehensive analysis paper

assessments.title: Final Research Paper
assessments.description: Final research paper on chosen literary topic

textbooks: The Norton Anthology of English Literature
Critical Theory Today: A User-Friendly Guide
otherInfo: Essays must be double-spaced with 12pt font
Late papers will lose 5% per day
Office hours are available for paper consultations

courses.name: Introduction to Macroeconomics]**

assessments.title: Before classes: Pre-Lecture Learning Curve (Part 1-4)
assessments.description: Before classes: Pre-Lecture Learning Curve (Part 1-4) - 4% each part (16% total)

assessments.description: [Date]: Homework Assignments - Not specified

assessments.title: Assigned through Achieve; mastery-based grading; due dates on Achieve site.
assessments.description: Assigned through Achieve; mastery-based grading; due dates on Achieve site.

assessments.title: February 1st, 6 pm: Midterm Test #1
assessments.description: February 1st, 6 pm: Midterm Test #1 - 15%

assessments.title: April 9th to 27th: Final Exam
assessments.description: April 9th to 27th: Final Exam - 35%

textbooks: Principles of Macroeconomics, 1st Canadian Edition (2023) by Milligan, Oreopoulos, Stevenson, and Wolfers
E-text with Achieve: $74.99 (includes Achieve and iClicker access)
E-text, Achieve with Looseleaf Print: $116.00 (includes Achieve and iClicker access)
otherInfo: All course content and assessment are subject to change; changes will be posted to the EC140 MyLearningSpace page.
Lectures will be live-streamed and recorded on Zoom (not guaranteed for all lectures).
Tutorials are scheduled occasionally on Zoom and will be recorded.
Students must register for Achieve through MyLearningSpace.
Late submissions for minor assessments are not accepted.  Only the best 12 minor assessment grades (out of at least 15) in each of the four parts count towards the overall grade.

Students who miss a midterm for religious observance, academic conflict, or varsity athletics may be eligible to write at an alternate time (notification required early).  Other missed midterms result in grade weight shifted to the final.
Students missing the final exam for an acceptable reason may apply for a deferred exam (late May/early June).
Students are permitted a non-programmable, non-graphing calculator and a single 8.5” x 11” sheet of notes for midterms and final.
Course materials are the instructor's intellectual property; unauthorized recording or distribution is prohibited.  Class recording consent is implied by attendance.
